phrase: Man is not concerned so much with real problems as with his imagined anxieties about real problems.
author: Epictetus

phrase: Anyone capable of annoying you becomes your teacher; Someone can bother you only when you allow yourself to be bothered by them.
author: Epictetus

phrase: “Who is the rich man?” they asked, and Epictetus answered, “He who is content.”
author: Epictetus

phrase: Nowhere can man find a retreat so imperturbable and tranquil as in the intimacy of his soul.
author: Marcus Aurelius

phrase: All things are intertwined with each other and their common bond is sacred and almost none of them is strange to the other, because they are all coordinated and contribute to the order of the same world.
author: Marcus Aurelius

phrase: If we seek the good of our fellow men we will find our own
author: Plato

phrase: True philosophers are those who enjoy contemplating the truth.
author: Plato

phrase: Once you have begun to know yourself, it is impossible not to fall in love with the idea of ​​seeing things as they are.
author: Plato

phrase: I consider the one who conquers his desires to be braver than the one who conquers his enemies, since the hardest victory is the victory over oneself.
author: Aristotle

phrase: I prefer knowledge to wealth, since the former is perennial, while the latter is expired.
author: Socrates

phrase: The greatest blessing given to humanity can come from the hand of madness
author: Socrates
